services.description: Scalable virtual cloud instances (VMs) providing a wide range of compute power, from development to high-performance production workloads. Features include flexible IPs, security groups, and local NVMe or Block Storage options.

Fully dedicated bare metal servers with cloud-native integration. Offers the performance of dedicated hardware with the flexibility of hourly billing, fast delivery, and integration with VPC, private networks, and other cloud services.

Historical range of premium dedicated servers for high-performance and intensive workloads. Available with monthly billing, offering a vast choice of hardware configurations, including high-end GPUs and large storage capacities.

Mac-as-a-Service solution providing dedicated Mac mini M1, M2, and M4 instances. Designed for developing, building, testing, and signing applications for the Apple ecosystem (iOS, macOS) with full native performance.

Specialized virtual instances equipped with NVIDIA GPUs (H100, L40S, L4, P100) for AI, machine learning, rendering, and video processing tasks. Provides powerful parallel computing capabilities on demand.

Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) platform allowing developers to deploy code snippets that run on demand without managing infrastructure. Supports multiple languages and scales automatically based on event triggers.

Run containerized applications in a serverless environment. Scales containers from zero to handle traffic spikes, eliminating the need to manage servers or clusters while paying only for resources used during execution.
Fully managed batch computing service for running short-lived tasks and large-scale data processing jobs. Handles scheduling, execution, and resource provisioning for containerized batch workloads.

Fully managed shared web hosting service with cPanel support. Provides a simple and secure environment for hosting websites and emails, including free SSL certificates, automated backups, and one-click CMS installations.

S3-compatible object storage service for storing and retrieving any amount of data. Features standard Multi-AZ redundancy, lifecycle rules, bucket versioning, and object locking for data durability and high availability.

Cold storage class within Object Storage designed for long-term data archiving and backup. Offers a cost-effective solution for data that is infrequently accessed, with secure retention and retrieval options.

High-performance, low-latency persistent block storage volumes (SSD) that can be attached to Compute Instances and Kubernetes nodes. Supports resizing, snapshots, and decoupling from instances for flexible data management.

Isolated network environment allowing users to provision private networks and connect cloud resources securely. Enables segmentation, traffic control, and secure communication between instances, databases, and other services.

Managed NAT gateway service providing internet access for resources in a Private Network. Enables instances with private IPs to initiate outbound connections while remaining inaccessible from the public internet.

Fully managed Layer 4 and Layer 7 load balancing service. Distributes incoming traffic across multiple backend servers to ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and automatic scaling of applications.
Domain name registration and managed DNS service. Allows users to buy, transfer, and manage domain names and configure DNS zones with support for DNSSEC and advanced record types.

IP Address Management service to centralize and simplify the management of IP resources across the Scaleway infrastructure. key features include reserving, attaching, and monitoring public and private IP addresses.

Fully managed Kubernetes service certified by the CNCF. Handles the control plane management, allowing users to focus on deploying containerized applications with integrated auto-scaling, healing, and monitoring.

Multi-cloud Kubernetes engine allowing the attachment of nodes from any cloud provider or on-premise infrastructure to a single managed control plane. Unifies container management across hybrid environments.
Fully managed Docker container registry for storing, managing, and securing container images. Integrated with Kapsule and other services, offering private repositories and image visibility control.

services.service_name: Managed Database for PostgreSQL and MySQL
services.description: Fully managed relational database service for PostgreSQL and MySQL. Provides high availability, automated backups, auto-scaling, and security features, removing the burden of database administration.
Managed in-memory data store based on Redis™. Optimized for caching, session management, and real-time analytics, offering high performance, persistence, and cluster mode options.
Fully managed NoSQL document database service compatible with MongoDB. Offers automatic scaling, backups, and high availability for building modern, flexible, and data-intensive applications.
Auto-scaling, serverless PostgreSQL-compatible database. Automatically adjusts compute and storage resources based on demand and scales to zero when idle, optimizing costs for variable workloads.
Managed Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) database based on ClickHouse. Designed for high-performance real-time analytics on large volumes of data with columnar storage and fast query execution.
Cloud-native messaging system based on NATS. Facilitates high-performance, lightweight communication for microservices, IoT, and distributed systems with pub/sub and request-reply patterns.
Managed message queuing service compatible with SQS. Enables decoupling of microservices and distributed systems by providing a reliable buffer for messages between producers and consumers.
Managed pub/sub messaging service compatible with SNS. Allows fan-out message delivery to multiple subscribers (endpoints, queues, functions) from a single topic for event-driven architectures.

Managed OpenSearch service for search, analytics, and visualization. Provides a distributed engine to index, search, and analyze large datasets in near real-time, often used for log analytics and application search.
Managed environment for Apache Spark, enabling large-scale data processing and machine learning tasks. Simplifies the deployment and management of Spark clusters for data engineers and scientists.
Deploy and run AI models in production with a fully managed inference infrastructure. Supports autoscaling and provides secure endpoints for serving machine learning models with low latency.

Access foundational generative AI models (LLMs like Llama, Mistral) via simple API calls. Allows developers to integrate AI capabilities into applications without managing underlying infrastructure or models.

Centralized service for managing user access and permissions across the Scaleway organization. Supports policies, groups, and API keys to enforce granular security controls and least privilege principles.
Secure storage and lifecycle management for sensitive data such as API keys, passwords, and certificates. Enables programmatic access to secrets while keeping them encrypted and audit-logged.
Managed Key Management Service (KMS) for creating, storing, and managing cryptographic keys. integrated with other Scaleway services to control data encryption and meet compliance requirements.
Governance tool that logs all API activities and events within a Scaleway Organization. Provides visibility into who did what and when, aiding in security auditing, compliance, and troubleshooting.

Fully managed observability platform based on Grafana, Prometheus, and Loki. Aggregates metrics, logs, and traces from Scaleway resources and external sources into a unified dashboard for monitoring and alerting.

Managed email delivery service optimized for transactional emails. Provides high deliverability, real-time analytics, and easy integration via API or SMTP for sending notifications, password resets, and alerts.
Managed MQTT broker connecting IoT devices to the cloud. Enables secure bi-directional communication, device management, and message routing to other Scaleway services for processing and storage.

Suite of edge computing features including Web Application Firewall (WAF) and Caching. Improves application performance and security by processing requests closer to the user and filtering malicious traffic.

Flexible virtual cloud instances (VMs) ranging from cost-effective development sandboxes (Stardust, Play2) to high-performance production workloads (Enterprise, GP1). Features include flexible IPs, security groups, and local NVMe options.

Virtual instances equipped with dedicated NVIDIA GPUs (L4, L40S, H100 PCIe, P100) designed for AI training, rendering, and video encoding. Offers pass-through performance for heavy parallel computing tasks.

NVIDIA DGX H100 SuperPOD infrastructure designed for training massive AI models. Provides interconnected H100 SXM5 GPUs with high-bandwidth NVIDIA Quantum-2 InfiniBand networking for extreme performance.

Dedicated bare metal servers delivered with cloud-native flexibility. Users get full hardware control without a hypervisor, integrated with VPC and billed hourly. Supports various configurations including Aluminium, Beryllium, and Lithium.
World's first RISC-V servers available in the cloud (EM-RV1). Based on the T-HEAD TH1520 SoC, these servers allow developers to build and test applications on the open RISC-V architecture natively.

Premium range of dedicated servers for intensive workloads, offering a vast selection of hardware (Intel/AMD), high bandwidth, and storage options. Managed via a specific console with monthly billing and long-term stability.
Mac-as-a-Service providing dedicated Mac mini M1, M2, and M4 instances. Essential for CI/CD pipelines targeting the Apple ecosystem (iOS/macOS), enabling native building and signing of applications.
Event-driven compute service that lets developers deploy code snippets (Python, Go, Node.js, etc.) without managing servers. Scales strictly based on demand, scaling to zero when not in use.
Deploys containerized applications in a fully managed serverless environment using Knative. Handles infrastructure scaling automatically, allowing usage of custom runtimes and binaries.
Managed batch computing service for running finite, short-lived tasks. Ideal for data processing, reporting, and asynchronous workflows, managing the queue and execution resources automatically.
Quantum-as-a-Service offering access to real Quantum Processing Units (QPUs) from partners like Pasqal, IQM, and AQT, as well as high-performance quantum emulators (Aer, Qsim) running on NVIDIA GPUs.
Managed shared hosting solution with cPanel. Provides a secure and maintenance-free environment for websites and emails, featuring automated backups, DDoS protection, and free SSL.
S3-compatible storage service for unstructured data. Features Multi-AZ redundancy, bucket versioning, object locking, and distinct storage classes (Standard, One Zone - IA) to optimize costs.
Deep archive storage class for long-term data retention. Designed for rarely accessed data like backups and logs, offering the lowest cost per GB with retrieval times ranging from minutes to hours.
High-speed network-attached SSD volumes (5,000 to 15,000 IOPS) for instances and Kubernetes nodes. Supports dynamic resizing, snapshots, and can be detached/reattached to different compute resources.
Regional Software Defined Network (SDN) enabling the creation of isolated private networks. Connects instances, databases, and load balancers securely with segmentation and private IP addressing.
Managed NAT gateway service. Allows resources within a private VPC to access the internet for updates or external APIs while preventing unsolicited inbound traffic from reaching them.
Managed Layer 4 (TCP) and Layer 7 (HTTP/HTTPS) load balancer. Distributes traffic across backend services to ensure high availability, SSL termination, and health checking.
Registrar and Managed DNS service. Allows purchasing domain names and managing DNS records (A, CNAME, MX, etc.) with support for DNSSEC and API automation.

Physical direct connectivity service linking on-premises infrastructure or other cloud providers directly to Scaleway VPCs via fiber cross-connects, bypassing the public internet for better security and latency.
Managed VPN Gateway allowing secure, encrypted IPsec tunnels between Scaleway Private Networks (VPC) and remote office networks or other cloud environments.
Fully managed Kubernetes service. Scaleway manages the control plane (master nodes) at no cost, while users pay for the worker nodes (instances) which can auto-scale and auto-heal.
Multi-cloud Kubernetes engine. Extends a managed control plane to nodes running on any infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or on-premise), creating a unified cluster across hybrid environments.
Managed registry for storing and delivering container images (Docker/OCI). Integrated with Kapsule and Serverless, featuring vulnerability scanning and image privacy policies.
Fully managed PostgreSQL service offering high availability, automated backups, and read replicas. Supports extensions like PostGIS and pgvector for geospatial and AI vector workloads.
Managed MySQL service handling provisioning, patching, and backups. Optimized for web applications with options for high-availability nodes and easy scaling.
In-memory data store service supporting Redis protocols. used for caching and session management with support for standalone or cluster modes to ensure performance and durability.
Official managed service for MongoDB. Provides a document-oriented NoSQL database with native auto-scaling, backup management, and integration with the Scaleway ecosystem.
Fully managed Apache Kafka service for real-time data streaming and pipelines. Handles cluster deployment and maintenance, allowing users to focus on producing and consuming event streams.
Managed OLAP database based on ClickHouse. Engineered for real-time analytics on massive datasets, delivering ultra-fast query performance with columnar storage.
On-demand PostgreSQL-compatible database that scales compute and storage automatically based on traffic. Ideal for variable workloads and prototypes, billing only for active usage.
Managed search and analytics suite based on OpenSearch. Enables ingestion, search, and visualization of data (logs, metrics, documents) with integrated Dashboards.
Managed Apache Spark environment for big data processing and machine learning. Allows deploying Spark clusters quickly to run ETL jobs and data analysis tasks.
Cloud-native messaging system based on NATS. Provides lightweight, high-performance pub/sub communication for microservices and distributed systems.
Managed message queue service (compatible with SQS). Decouples application components by buffering messages to ensure reliable asynchronous processing.
Managed pub/sub notification service (compatible with SNS). Fans out messages from a single event source to multiple subscribers like functions, queues, or HTTP endpoints.
Deploys open-source AI models (from Hugging Face, etc.) on managed GPU infrastructure. Provides secure API endpoints for inference without managing the underlying hardware.
Provides instant access to leading foundation models (Llama, Mistral) via API. Enables developers to integrate LLM capabilities like text generation and chat into apps without model hosting.
Centralized access control system. Manages users, groups, applications, and policies to enforce least-privilege access across all Scaleway resources.
Secure vault for storing and managing sensitive credentials like API keys, passwords, and certificates. Supports versioning and strict access control.
Managed Key Management Service (KMS) for generating, storing, and controlling cryptographic keys (HSM-backed) used to encrypt data across Scaleway services.
Governance service that records API activity and events within the organization. Provides logs for security auditing, compliance tracking, and forensic analysis.
Managed observability platform based on Grafana, Mimir (Prometheus), and Loki. Aggregates metrics, logs, and traces from Scaleway resources and custom agents into unified dashboards.
High-deliverability email sending service for application notifications. Supports SMTP and API integration with features for template management and reputation monitoring.
Dashboard service that tracks and reports the carbon and water footprint of your cloud infrastructure usage, aiding in sustainability reporting and optimization.
Managed MQTT broker for connecting IoT devices. Handles device authentication, message routing to cloud services, and 'Device Twins' for state management.
Caching layer for Object Storage and Load Balancers. Caches content at the network edge to reduce latency and data transfer costs for end-users.
Security service deployed at the edge to protect web applications from common attacks (OWASP Top 10, SQL injection) by filtering malicious traffic before it reaches the backend.

Colocation service allowing you to host your own hardware in Scaleway's secure datacenters (e.g., DC5). Provides standard racks, power, and high-performance network connectivity while you manage the physical hardware.
Fully managed Network Attached Storage (NFS) service. Allows multiple instances and Kubernetes nodes to mount shared file systems simultaneously, ideal for content management and shared workloads.
Financial operations tool providing visibility into cloud spend. Features billing alerts, consumption analysis, and invoice breakdown to help optimize infrastructure costs.
